description: From varix, via Middle English [Term?] from Latin varix, ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *wers-; surface analysis, varic- +‎ -ose. See also Old Church Slavonic врьхъ (vrĭxŭ, “top, peak”), Ancient Greek ἕρμα (hérma, “reef, rock, hill”), Lithuanian viršus (“top”).

adjectives.description: varicose (comparative more varicose, superlative most varicose)

entries.meaning: (usually of a vein or set of veins) Abnormally swollen, dilated or knotty.
